title: Revelation: Witness in Conflict
objective: Discern spiritual conflict through the trumpets, witnesses, and war imagery of Revelation.

required_passages.text: The trumpet judgments continued... the two witnesses testified... the dragon made war... the Lamb stood on Mount Zion... Here is a call for the endurance of the saints.

segments.audio_script: Revelation now unveils intensified conflict between the kingdom of God and powers of evil.

Listen to Revelation 9-14. Trumpet judgments warn rebellious humanity. John sees the scroll and the two witnesses who prophesy faithfully amid opposition. A heavenly war vision reveals the dragon's rage against God's people. Beasts represent deceptive and oppressive powers. Yet the Lamb stands victorious with His people, and final harvest imagery signals coming judgment and vindication.
Symbolic visions communicate recurring patterns of persecution, deception, and witness across church history.
Revelation calls believers to discern idolatrous systems, refuse compromise, and endure in faithful witness. Victory belongs to the Lamb, even when suffering is severe.
Key themes include spiritual warfare, prophetic witness, deception, endurance, allegiance, and Lamb-centered victory.
Reflect on this: Where are you pressured to compromise allegiance to Christ for security or acceptance?
Endure faithfully; the Lamb's victory is sure. Next, final bowl judgments and Babylon's fall are revealed.
